When you Adjust the end date of a contract to extend it, the end date of any associated asset(s) changes to match the new contract end date. All other contract dates, including notification dates, are recalculated automatically based on the new end date.
You can extend a contract that meets the following conditions:
State is Active or Expired
Substate is None or Rejected

Selected Answer: AD
Active & Expired

Selected Answer: AD
Active or Expired

questions.question_text: What are the three types of catalogs in ServiceNow? (Choose three.)

choices.A: When stock is less than the threshold specified in the stock rule
choices.D: By notifying the stockroom manager of new transfer orders
choices.C: By creating transfer orders to restock from other stockrooms
choices.B: By creating a purchase orders to restock from other stockrooms

discussion.content: Both B and C are correct. This scheduled job runs daily and not when stock has breached a threshold. It creates either a transfer order or a purchase order.

comments.content: "Stock rule runner runs everyday to create transfer orders or purchase orders or stock orders (HAM feature), sends email messages to stockroom managers, and create tasks for stockroom managers." - https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/c_StockRules.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When stock is less than the threshold specified in the stock rule
im voting for C

A or C could be correct page 405 of Tokyo Book
"IF the available stock falls below the defined threshold"
"Create a transfer order to restock from another stockroom"

Selected Answer: A
Its A. A stock rule is a system defined criteria that automatically creates a purchase order od a transfer order when the amount in stock assets for a given hardware model drops below the defined threshold.

questions.question_text: The Stock Rule Runner scheduled job replenishes stock in a stockroom__________.
